projects.title: Evaluating Trade-offs Between LiDAR Specifications and Autonomy Performance
projects.one_liner: Migrated navigation stack from ROS 1 to ROS 2 and evaluated LiDAR specifications for drone autonomy
projects.team: Applied Intuition with Korean Tier-1 sensor supplier
problem: GPS-denied indoor navigation needed ROS 2 migration
LiDAR specifications varied widely but performance impact unclear
Dense urban drone scenarios required robust path planning
Needed quantitative evaluation framework for autonomy performance
approach: Migrated GPS-denied indoor navigation stack from ROS 1 to ROS 2
Integrated with simulation APIs for consistent testing environment
Implemented RRT-based path planning and collision avoidance
Built evaluation pipelines measuring success rate, completion time, replanning count, and path length
contributions: Successfully migrated entire navigation stack from ROS 1 to ROS 2
Implemented robust collision avoidance for dense urban scenarios
Delivered detailed analysis of LiDAR specification trade-offs
results: Completed full ROS 1 to ROS 2 migration maintaining functionality
Provided quantitative insights on LiDAR performance trade-offs
Findings led to proof-of-concept agreement between collaborating companies
Established standardized evaluation framework for future sensor comparisons

projects.title: SQUIRREL - Multi-Agent UAV System
projects.one_liner: DARPA-funded project: architected multi-agent UAV system with robust mesh networking
problem: Multi-agent UAV systems needed robust communication in contested environments
Network overhead limited swarm scalability and coordination
Hardware integration required custom solutions for mesh networking
Real-time exchange of network, battery, and GPS data needed for swarm coordination
approach: Architected multi-agent UAV system with mesh networking between ground and soldier agents
Implemented serialization optimizations and JSON-RPC for efficient communication
Led hardware integration with custom 3D-printed components and mesh radio tuning
Developed swarm manager for real-time data exchange and coordination
contributions: Designed and implemented robust mesh networking architecture
Reduced network overhead by 50% through serialization optimizations
Led hardware integration with 3D-printed components and radio tuning
Built swarm manager enabling real-time coordination across agents
results: Reduced network overhead by 50% improving swarm scalability
Successfully demonstrated multi-agent coordination in field tests
Delivered robust mesh networking system for contested environments
Enabled real-time exchange of critical swarm data (network, battery, GPS)

projects.title: GPS-Denied Indoor Navigation – NIST 5.0 3D Mapping Challenge
projects.one_liner: Implemented advanced 3D mapping using Gaussian Splatting for GPS-denied environments
problem: GPS-denied environments required robust 3D mapping and navigation
Standard mapping produced low-quality results in complex indoor environments
Needed real-time 3D object detection overlay on maps
Cost constraints required building capable FPV drone under $2,500
approach: Implemented post-processing pipelines for high-quality 3D mapping using Gaussian Splatting
Developed ROS-based 3D object detection overlaying bounding boxes on Voxblox mesh maps
Customized VOXL-PX4 firmware for range-sensor-based VIO correction
Built custom FPV drone with optimized components
contributions: Implemented Gaussian Splatting pipeline for high-quality 3D reconstruction
Developed 3D object detection system overlaying results on mesh maps
Customized VOXL-PX4 firmware for improved VIO in GPS-denied environments
Built custom FPV drone achieving 15+ minute flight time
results: Achieved high-quality 3D mapping in complex GPS-denied environments
Successfully integrated 3D object detection with mapping pipeline
Built FPV drone with 15+ minute flight time under $2,500 budget

projects.title: Automated Shot Group Size Measuring System
projects.one_liner: IEEE-published vision-based system for remote ballistic analysis with 91.8% accuracy
problem: Manual shot group measurement was time-consuming and error-prone
Remote ballistic analysis required automated, contactless measurement
Needed high accuracy for precision shooting analysis
Integration of IoT components for remote data collection required
approach: Led development of vision-based shot group measurement system
Implemented bullet hole detection using OpenCV-based image warping and alignment
Trained YOLOv3 models optimized for embedded inference
Integrated IoT components including Raspberry Pi, sound sensors, cameras, and LoRa
contributions: Led complete system development from concept to implementation
Implemented image warping and alignment achieving 91.8% accuracy
Trained and optimized YOLOv3 models for embedded deployment
Integrated multi-modal IoT sensors for remote data collection
results: Achieved 91.8% accuracy in shot group measurement
Resulted in peer-reviewed publication at IEEE SAS 2022
Integrated complete IoT system for automated data collection
